page.title: 01KEMBLE - 1
page.content: The village of{Kemble}in{ {Gloucestershire}is situated 4 miles S.E. of{Cirencester}on both sides of the main A 429 road to{Malmesbury.}It is located amidst undulating, attractive countryside at the head of the upper{Thames}valley and is the nearest village to the traditional source of the{River Thames. The name{Kemble}is probably derived from the early Saxon word meaning "boundary". Until 1896{Kemble}and Poole Keynes were part of Wiltshire. The village grew in size when the {Great Western Railway}line was built in 1841. In the centre of{Kemble}there is an elevated village green with an old drinking fountain in a{Cotswold stone arched shelter.
